channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-5119] testQualifiers(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store.AccessTest)java.sql.SQLException: Table/View 'FOO' already exists in Schema 'APP'.
item.description:

Note this was followed by another failure DERBY-4550. Not sure if the failure to create the table might have impacted that test.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Linking this to an already resolved bug, DERBY-4523. Do you have a log of the order in which the test cases executed? The test seems to assume that cases will execute in the order that they appear in the source file, but JUnit does not guarantee this. This kind of error sometimes flags an instability in the order of test cases.

In this test most fixtures create and later drop the table foo. If any of the prior fixtures fail. On this day testCaseCS4595B_NonUniqueIndex DERBY-4540, then the subsequent fixture will fail trying to create table foo.

I think I will just add to the teardown method to drop foo if it exists, so the fixtures don't impact each other.
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.
